alert.note: Alert for Alachua; Columbia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 21 at 10:34AM EST until December 24 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Florida... Santa Fe River near High Springs affecting Alachua and Columbia Counties. Additional information is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/forecasts.php?wfo=jax. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 1045 AM EST. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Santa Fe River near High Springs. * WHEN...From late tonight to Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 33.0 feet, High water will begin to impact docks and boat ramps in the area. At 34.2 feet, Florida Fish and Wildlife Commission begins enforcement of a no wake zone on the Santa Fe River from the River Rise in O`Leno State Park downstream to the center line of the US 27 Bridge. At 35.0 feet, Wooded areas along the river begin to flood. The boat ramp south of US-441 in Alachua County is inaccessible above this level. At 37.0 feet, Water begins to approach two residences along the river at the end of Southeast Resort Circle in Columbia County. The boat ramp near the US-27 bridge in Columbia County begins to flood at this level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EST Thursday the stage was 34.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 35.5 feet early Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
